main_text.sentence: Kim and colleagues similarly failed to identify JC virus in 15 medulloblastomas, 5 sPNET and 2 medulloblastoma cell lines [46].
Global gene expression profiles also suggest that medulloblastoma, sPNET and ATRT are distinct entities [4].
Transgenic mice containing JC virus early region sequences also develop medulloblastomas [44].
Hayashi and colleagues failed to identify JC viral sequences in 13 medulloblastomas [45].
Second, inactivation of p53 accelerates the formation of medulloblastomas in transgenic mouse models [19].
Thymidilate synthetase and Topoisomarese 2A were over-expressed in glioblastoma as well as in our previous study of medulloblastoma [1].
Classic, desmoplastic/nodular and large cell/anaplastic medulloblastomas were classified using World Health Organization guidelines [1].
It was shown decades ago that inoculation of JC virus into rodents resulted in formation of medulloblastoma-like cerebellar tumors [20,22,42,43].
